title: Formation of secondary aerosol from emissions of a Euro 6d-compliant gasoline vehicle with a particle filter
content:
Environ. Sci.: Atmos., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D3EA00165B, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Andreas Paul, Zheng Fang, Patrick Martens, Arya Mukherjee, Gert Jakobi, Mika Ihalainen, Miika Kortelainen, Markus Somero, Pasi Yli-Pirilä, Thorsten Hohaus, Hendryk Czech, Markus Kalberer, Olli Sippula, Yinon Rudich, Ralf Zimmermann, Astrid Kiendler-Scharr
The exhaust of a Euro 6d compliant car with a three-way catalyst and GPF preinstalled was studied. The GPF removed almost all primary particles, however oxidation of emitted VOCs such as toluene and xylene led to significant SOA formation.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
